alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 6:16PM EDT until April 10 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...In Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN and Ripley Counties. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, emergency management reported minor flooding in the advisory area, including along Laughery Creek. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Harrison, Batesville, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Brookville, Bright, Hidden Valley, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester, Sunman and St. Leon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
